title: Crossing the Jordan
shortSummary: Joshua 3 describes the miraculous crossing of the Jordan River by the Israelites under Joshua’s leadership, marking a pivotal moment as they enter the Promised Land. The chapter highlights God’s presence with His people through the Ark of the Covenant and His power to perform wonders on their behalf.
timeline: c. 1406 BC - Israelite Entry into Canaan

keyCharacters.name: Joshua
keyCharacters.description: The leader of Israel after Moses, charged with guiding the people into the Promised Land and demonstrating God’s power and faithfulness.

keyCharacters.name: The Priests
keyCharacters.description: Levites who carry the Ark of the Covenant and play a crucial role in the miraculous crossing of the Jordan River.

keyCharacters.name: Officers of Israel
keyCharacters.description: Leaders who organize the people and communicate God’s commands as they prepare to cross the Jordan.

definitions.definition: A sacred chest containing the tablets of the Law, symbolizing God's presence and covenant with Israel.
An ancient unit of measurement roughly equal to 18 inches, used here to describe the distance the people must keep from the Ark.
To set apart as holy; in this context, the people are called to purify themselves in preparation for God’s miraculous work.
The river that the Israelites must cross to enter the land God promised them, symbolizing transition and divine provision.

outline.heading: Preparation to Cross Jordan
outline.description: Joshua leads Israel to the Jordan River and instructs them to sanctify themselves, preparing spiritually and physically for the miraculous crossing that will demonstrate God’s power.

outline.heading: Instructions Regarding the Ark
outline.description: God commands Joshua to have the priests carry the Ark ahead of the people, signaling God’s presence and guiding Israel’s path, with specific instructions on how to approach the river.

outline.heading: Miraculous Crossing of the Jordan
outline.description: As the priests’ feet touch the water, the river stops flowing, allowing the entire nation to cross on dry ground, confirming God’s faithfulness and Joshua’s leadership.

application: Trust God’s timing and prepare your heart through sanctification when facing new challenges or transitions.
Follow God’s guidance closely, recognizing His presence as the true leader in every step of your journey.
Have faith that God can perform miracles in your life, even when circumstances seem impossible.
Obediently respond to God’s commands, knowing that His plans are perfect and His power is sufficient.

keyVerses.text: And Joshua said unto the people, Sanctify yourselves: for to morrow the LORD will do wonders among you.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the necessity of holiness and preparation to witness God’s miraculous work.

keyVerses.text: And the LORD said unto Joshua, This day will I begin to magnify thee in the sight of all Israel, that they may know that, as I was with Moses, so I will be with thee.
keyVerses.significance: God’s promise to Joshua assures divine presence and authority, encouraging faith in leadership.

keyVerses.text: And it shall come to pass, as soon as the soles of the feet of the priests that bear the ark of the LORD, the Lord of all the earth, shall rest in the waters of Jordan, that the waters of Jordan shall be cut off from the waters that come down from above; and they shall stand upon an heap.
keyVerses.significance: This verse describes the miraculous event that confirms God’s power and faithfulness to His people.

keyVerses.text: And the priests that bare the ark of the covenant of the LORD stood firm on dry ground in the midst of Jordan, and all the Israelites passed over on dry ground, until all the people were passed clean over Jordan.
keyVerses.significance: The successful crossing on dry ground symbolizes God’s provision and the fulfillment of His promises.
